DOC.brief_summary: This study prospective , randomize , double-blinded trial involve adult patient diagnose Myofascial Pain Syndromes ( MPS ) . The purpose research study compare therapeutic difference trigger point injection normal saline conventional drug mix ( local anesthesic + steroid ) treat MPS . In particular , find pain level duration injection .
DOC.brief_title: Using Saline Myofascial Pain Syndromes ( USAMPS )
DOC.detailed_description: This study prospective , randomize , double-blinded trial involve adult patient diagnose Myofascial Pain Syndromes ( MPS ) . The purpose research study compare therapeutic difference trigger point injection normal saline conventional drug mix ( lidocaine+ triamcinolone acetonide ) treat MPS . In particular , find pain level duration injection . Enrolled patient randomly assign receive trigger point injection contain either saline ( arm one ) conventional drug mix ( arm two ) treat muscle pain . Upon discharge , patient receive instruction regular active muscle stretch plan restore muscle function . Patients ask pain level treatment . In addition , patient follow two week treatment find pain status treatment satisfaction . Currently , standard protocol study emergency department treat patient MPS . The result study potentially improve pain management emergency department .
DOC.criteria: Adult patient diagnose MPS trapezius , gluteus medius/minimus , iliocostalis thoracislumborum , quadratus Lumborum , paraspinal muscle emergency department . Patients allergic lidocaine and/or steroid . Pregnant woman . Prisoners . Patients cognitively impaired and/or unable consent study . Age < 18 . Signs localized infection skin breakdown injection site .
